Diagnosis
	1. Cutaneous melanoma right calf, pT2bN1M0
	Breslow 2.8mm, ulcerated, 1 positive sentinel node

	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Wide local excision right calf with 2cm margins and sentinel lymph node biopsy
	02 Apr 2024 Completion lymph node dissection right groin

	Chemotherapy
	Not indicated

	Clinical studies
	IMPACT-Mel trial registration completed today

	Current disease status
	No evidence of residual disease post-surgery

	Current issues
	Post-operative wound healing right groin

	Summary of consultation
	This 45-year-old lady has been reviewed today following completion of surgical treatment for her NRAS Q61K positive melanoma. The primary lesion was a 2.8mm Breslow thickness ulcerated melanoma of the right calf, with one positive sentinel node from three sampled. Subsequent completion lymphadenectomy showed no additional nodal involvement from 12 nodes examined.

I have discussed at length the role of adjuvant immunotherapy in her situation. Given her high-risk features including ulceration and nodal involvement, she meets criteria for the IMPACT-Mel trial comparing standard adjuvant anti-PD1 therapy versus combination immunotherapy. We have reviewed the trial protocol, potential benefits, and side effect profile of both treatment arms in detail.

She has completed all screening investigations including CT chest/abdomen/pelvis on 15/4/24 showing no evidence of metastatic disease, and normal baseline blood tests including LFTs, TFTs, and cortisol. Her right groin wound is healing well with minimal seroma.

	Further investigations
	Baseline brain MRI scheduled 22/4/24
	Baseline cardiac echo and ECG arranged for 24/4/24

	Medication prescribed
	None

	Follow up
	Trial randomisation visit scheduled 29/4/24
First treatment planned 2/5/24
Surgical follow-up with Mr [redacted name] arranged for 3 months

	Required GP actions
	Weekly blood monitoring as per trial protocol once treatment commences
Urgent review if immune-related symptoms develop

	Summary of information given to the patient
	Full trial information pack provided
Written and verbal information about immunotherapy side effects
Trial emergency contact card issued
